usefulItems: small bowl, serving bowls, thermal serving bowl or other large bowl
title: Hearty seafood chowder

ingredients.content: 4 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only, plus extra for garnishing
½ bunch fresh chives, cut into thirds
200 g carrot, cut into pieces (approx. 2 cm)
80 g celery, cut into pieces (approx. 2 cm)
2 potatoes (approx. 200 g), peeled and cut into pieces (approx. 2 cm)
200 g firm white fish fillets, cut into pieces (approx. 2-3 cm)
150 g large raw prawns, peeled and deveined
100 g smoked salmon, cut into pieces

preparations.content: Place parsley and chives into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a small bowl and set aside.
Place onion and garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add carrot and celery and chop <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 50 g of the butter and cook <b>5 min/100°C/speed 2<b>.
Add remaining 150 g butter, curry powder, salt, pepper, thyme and flour and cook <b>3 min/100°C/speed 2<b>.
Add wine, potatoes, stock and cream and cook <b>20-25 min/100°C/speed 2<b>, until potatoes are tender.
Add fish and Tabasco (optional) and cook <b>3 min/100°C//speed 1<b>.

Add prawns, scallops and reserved parsley mixture and cook <b>3 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Place a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh smoked salmon into it. Transfer chowder into thermal serving bowl and carefully stir to combine salmon. Serve garnished with extra parsley.

hintsAndTricks: To make your own fish stock, please refer to the recipe in this collection.
